meanings.definition: A person who is an expert in Jewish law.
meanings.sent1: The halachist provided guidance on the proper observance of Jewish law.
meanings.sent2: The halachist studied the Torah diligently to understand Jewish law better.
meanings.sent3: The halachist joked that even the birds in the sky followed Jewish law better than some people.
meanings.sent4: She was a halachist, navigating the intricate web of Jewish law like a skilled sailor on stormy seas.
meanings.sent5: The halachist's wisdom in Jewish law shone brightly in the community.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to Jewish law.
meanings.sent1: The halachist perspective on the issue provided valuable insights into Jewish law.
meanings.sent2: His halachist interpretation of the text shed light on the nuances of Jewish law.
meanings.sent3: The halachist approach to cooking kosher meals was both meticulous and creative.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a halachist labyrinth, filled with the intricate details of Jewish law.
meanings.sent5: The halachist influence could be seen in every aspect of the community's traditions.
